name: Subscribe to Download – Download after Email Subscription Form WordPress Plugin
author: WP Shuffle

sections.description:
Subscribe to Download Lite makes it fast and easy to capture subscribers right from your WordPress site by simply providing them freebies to download through email after successful subscription. If you don’t have any freebies to offer then you can even use our plugin just as a subscription plugin too.

Unlock the power of seamless content distribution with Subscribe to Download Lite – the ultimate solution for driving engagement through subscriptions. Supercharge your WordPress site by offering exclusive downloads in exchange for subscriptions, effortlessly managed through an array of user-friendly features.

Key Features

  • 🎨 Stunning Templates: Choose from 5 pre-designed subscription form templates that effortlessly blend with your site’s aesthetics, ensuring a captivating user experience.

  • 🔒 Encrypted Download Links: Secure your valuable content with encrypted download links, providing an added layer of protection for your premium offerings.

  • 🌐 Popup Subscription Form: Capture your audience’s attention with a sleek and customizable popup subscription form, strategically designed to boost subscription rates.

  • ⚙️ Component Control: Enjoy complete control over each form component – easily enable or disable elements to tailor the subscription process to your specific needs.

  • 🚀 Ajax Form Submission: Revolutionize the user experience with Ajax form submission, delivering a seamless and lightning-fast subscription process without page reloads.

  • 📊 CSV Export: Effortlessly manage your subscriber data with the ability to export subscribers’ details to a CSV file, ensuring seamless integration with your marketing strategies.

  • 👁️ Backend Form Preview: Fine-tune your subscription forms with confidence using the backend form preview, providing a real-time glimpse into the user experience.

  • 📱 Mobile Responsiveness: Ensure a flawless experience across all devices with a mobile-responsive design, catering to the diverse preferences of your audience.

  • 🌐 Translation Ready: Reach a global audience by easily translating the plugin into multiple languages, breaking down language barriers for effective communication.

  • 🎨 Customization Galore: Personalize the entire subscription process by customizing email messages, sender names, and sender email addresses, establishing a consistent brand presence.

Elevate your subscription game with Subscribe to Download Lite – the essential tool for WordPress site owners who prioritize user engagement, security, and customization. Download now and embark on a journey to redefine your content distribution strategy!

sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/subscribe-to-download-lite directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Use the Subscribe to Download Lite settings page to configure the plugin
sections.faq:
I don’t have freebies to offer. Can I use this plugin simply as a default Subscription Form ?

Yes, if you don’t provide any downloadable file in the plugin settings, then it will just act as the normal subscription form.

How is downloadable file received to the subscriber?

The subscriber will receive the link of the downloadable file in the email through which subscriber will be able to download.

How can I prevent the subscribers from direct link sharing of downloadable item?

Our plugin do have the feature to encrypt the download link so that it will only valid for the specific subscriber.

What happens when I turn on Encrypt Download Link?

When this option is turned on in the general settings, our plugin will send the encrypted download link instead of the direct file link for download and our plugin will use the browser cookies to verify if the link has been clicked from the same browser or not from which the subscription has been done. If the link has been clicked from different browser then it will just open the home page which will prevent the direct link sharing. And also it will help to track the download status for the specific subscriber.

When I click on the download link, it opens the home page instead of downloading the file?

That is because you may have turned on the Encrypt Download Link option. Please check above FAQ for the detail about this feature.

sections.reviews:
Updated review: Was great when testing, not so great when actually using

By stephunique on April 1, 2024

Edit: I previously gave it 5 stars while testing it. I am usually quick to judge with a positive bias because I want to thank the creators as soon as possible. However after actually using and not just testing this plugin, I have discovered some issues.

Number 1 is the plugin limits you to one form only. This was not specified anywhere, at least none that I could see, before I embarked on a journey to download, activate, test out the plugin. I would much rather have limited features and have a simple plugin with paid to upgrade for more features (eg more form fields) than a variety of features but only single use and it would have been good if the creators were upfront about this before I spent all my time testing it out.

Number 2 is that there is no way to delete the form already made. You can edit it, but you can't delete it. This is a little strange.

Bug report: I tried to change the heading and it won't update at all for some reason so I tried to delete the form and start over but there's no option to delete the form. At the moment the form heading says "This is a heading" (which is what I put while testing it) but since it can't update, I can't have that in my actual form, so I can't use it. I changed the heading then accessed the form on a totally different device and the form looks the same.

Yes, I have updated the plugin.

If you are fine with having just one form, which I guess I am fine with, then:

I’d like to leave some information for other users that I figured out.

Regarding the file download link working or not:

Link encryption is available if you want to hide the URL of the file to prevent direct download and to prevent link sharing. However I see that some people say this function leads their users to the homepage rather than the file itself. I did some testing and here is what I found:

With link encryption on:

If the user signs up in a normal (tracked) browser (ie, not private browsing) then clicks on the link in their email inbox in the same type of browser window (even in a different session after you closed the original browser, or in a different device), the link is encrypted and works, the user can download the file (the link leads directly to a download, not a page, so the real url is hidden and shows an encrypted link).

If the user signs up in a normal (tracked) browser (ie, not private browsing) then opens a private browsing window to click on the link in their email inbox, and even in a different device, the link is encrypted and still works, the user can download the file (like before, the link leads directly to a download, not a page, so the url is hidden).

However, the reverse is not true:

If the user signs up in a private browsing session and then tries to click on the link in their email in a normal browsing window or a new private browsing session, <span style=”font-size: inherit;”>ie, if you close the private browsing session by closing all of the private tabs, then try to access the link by opening a new private browsing session, the link no longer works. It will only work in the </span><strong style=”font-size: inherit;”>same private browsing session as the one the user signed up in.

WithOUT link encryption:

For me, the link still leads to a 403 error page which is good if you don’t want the file to be downloadable without signing up, but the URL of the file link is exposed, but given that the file is inaccessible anyway using this method, it doesn’t matter.

You can also download/export a CSV file of the subscribers of the form even in the free version.

There is a field in the free version for names so the plugin is fine the way it is for my purposes.

After the user signs up, the form is blank again so you can sign up again with a different email address, which is great (some plugins simply display a download button once an email address is already entered).

The support is also pretty good. Thank you for this plugin.

Feature suggestion: Tt would be great if the users that subscribe are automatically added to the Wordpress subscriber roles (or any other role of our choosing) so that other plugins that has automated actions (eg send newsletters to a specific group of users or role) can do the same for people from this subscriber's list.

Just what I needed

By joerucci on April 17, 2020

I needed to send my sample audio files to only subscribed users and this plugin just made it possible. Very very very happy with this plugin. Gracias!!

Very useful plugin and Top notch support

By endra71 on February 29, 2020

At first I was really confused with the link encryption feature but when I contacted the support they clarified me properly and assisted me without any delay to setup the plugin. Very useful plugin for collecting subscribers. Cheers!!

Nice Concept

By ecarla on January 15, 2020

The idea of this plugin is a good one.....when it works. It is easy enough to set up a download to attract new subscribers, and the pop-ups and static forms look good. However, I have had issues getting this to work consistently. One minute it works great, then the next I get emails from subscribers wondering where their download is (the link takes them to the home page). Not a way to build a subscriber base! I purchased the regular license thinking that customer service would help solve any glitches, but they have been slow to respond and not very helpful. I have deactivated the plugin for now.
